channel.title: Comments on: “Do you want to look at my jugs?” Or possibly an adventure in Asperger Syndrome? With help from Mungo Jerry and The Grateful Dead!
channel.description: Supporting children's language, communication and learning

item.title: By: Michael Jones
item.dc:creator: Michael Jones
item.description: Thanks Lisa!! By all accounts it was a strange festival, with several of the 'heavyweight' acts not really impressing the crowd. Still, it was the birthplace of Mungo Jerry, so we should be thankful for that. For a while after that there was a craze for men to have massive sideburns. Sideburns, like flares, seem to be well and truly a thing of the past. I'm reading 'Arthur and George' by Julian Barnes, and a lot of that is set in Staffordshire (It doesn't mention the Hollywood festival though) Great to hear from you! Michael xx
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Lisa!!
By all accounts it was a strange festival, with several of the ‘heavyweight’ acts not really impressing the crowd. Still, it was the birthplace of Mungo Jerry, so we should be thankful for that. For a while after that there was a craze for men to have massive sideburns. Sideburns, like flares, seem to be well and truly a thing of the past.
I’m reading ‘Arthur and George’ by Julian Barnes, and a lot of that is set in Staffordshire (It doesn’t mention the Hollywood festival though)
Great to hear from you!
Michael xx

item.title: By: Lisa Reynolds
item.dc:creator: Lisa Reynolds
item.description: As ever Michael, illuminating. Also great to see Newcastle under Lyme getting a mention
item.content:encoded: As ever Michael, illuminating. Also great to see Newcastle under Lyme getting a mention
